page.title: 15Farming at Pouchen End
page.content: This is a small farm of 80 acres that is run by the owner and his son.They have occasional help at busy times. The farmer described some of the many jobs they have to do including tractor and combine driving,field work,mucking out and feeding animals,building and maintaining outbuildings, getting in feed etc.,harvesting and hay making.He worked long hard hours but enjoyed it.Unlike an office job you grab a bit of spare time when you can get it, usually when the weather is very wet. They have 5 breeding sows who produce two litters each year,and have 1 field for horse grazing.They grow mainly winter wheat and barley with a little spring barley and grass for hay. Some barley is used as pig feed,some goes for maltings for beer but most of it goes to Piccotts End Mill to be made into cattle feed.
